title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.14 - Reports
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 33.14 - Reports

State Regulations
(a) Each permittee
authorized to sell alcoholic beverages by virtue of a permit issued pursuant to
subdivisions (a), (d), and (g) of section 99-b [of the Alcoholic Beverage

Control Law] and specifically every sheriff, marshal, assignee for the benefit
of creditors, trustee or receiver in bankruptcy, executor or administrator of
an estate, fire insurance company or fire salvage company, warehouseman, railroad company, steamship company, or other person who has acquired a lien
pursuant to law for the storage or carriage of alcoholic beverages, shall
furnish a report to the Authority setting forth therein the name, address, and
license number of the purchaser of alcoholic beverages at the sale consummated
under the terms of the permit, listing in the report the alcoholic beverages by
brand name, container size, and quantity together with the date of the sale and
the amount of money received. Such report shall be filed, within 30 days after
the date of the sale, at the zone office of the Authority which issued the
permit. (b) Where a permittee fails
to comply with the foregoing provisions no further permit shall be issued to
him except by approval of the members of the Authority. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
33.14

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
